docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) -- Representative August H. Andresen. Republican of Minnesota, submitted to the Committee for Reciprocity Information today a petition which, he said, was signed by nearly 100 Republican members of the House protesting the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) -- Representative August H. Andresen. Republican of Minnesota, submitted to the Committee for Reciprocity Information today a petition which, he said, was signed by nearly 100 Republican members of the House protesting the proposed negotiations of trade agreements with Argentina and Uruguay.

docs.snippet: LONDON, June 24 -- Ronald Ian Campbell, former British Minister to Belgrade, who had an exciting escape from that country and who played an important diplomatic part in Yugoslavia's decision to confront Reichsfuehrer Hitler rather than yield, is...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, June 24 -- Ronald Ian Campbell, former British Minister to Belgrade, who had an exciting escape from that country and who played an important diplomatic part in Yugoslavia's decision to confront Reichsfuehrer Hitler rather than yield, is going to the United States as Minister to Washington, succeeding Sir Gerald Campbell, it was announced today.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 25 -- Exports from the United States to the United Kingdom established a new twenty-year record in April as America's lease-lend aid program gained speed, the Department of Commerce reported today.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina. June 28 (UP) -- Indication that Brazil would accept the non-belligerency formula proposed by the Uruguayan Government to the other American republics was given today by the Brazilian Foreign Minister. Dr. Oswaldo Aranha.

docs.snippet: TRAVEL LINES: Scranton, Pa., celebrates its centennial July 23-30, and as the center of the world's richest anthracite deposits it will give visitors an opportunity to see the "workings" far underground, miles of under-surface roads, and that...
docs.lead_paragraph: TRAVEL LINES: Scranton, Pa., celebrates its centennial July 23-30, and as the center of the world's richest anthracite deposits it will give visitors an opportunity to see the "workings" far underground, miles of under-surface roads, and that vanishing American, the faithful mine mule who is rapidly being replaced by the electric motor. . .

headline.main: A TRAVEL MISCELLANY; Scranton to Mark Centenary -- New Air Services to North
